trans-unit.source: Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Determine the DNS name of the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves resources for redundancy or maintenance.
trans-unit.target: You can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves resources for redundancy or maintenance.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name will be stable because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)
trans-unit.target: The DNS name will be stable because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select **VIRTUAL MACHINES**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select **VIRTUAL MACHINES**.

trans-unit.source: On the **VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES** page, under the **Quick Glance** column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: On the **VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES** page, under the **Quick Glance** column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Database Engine from another computer
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Database Engine from another computer

trans-unit.source: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Server** or **Connect to Database Engine** dialog box, in the**Server name** box, enter the DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public endpoint port number in the format of *DNSName,portnumber* such as **tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Server** or **Connect to Database Engine** dialog box, in the**Server name** box, enter the DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public endpoint port number in the format of *DNSName,portnumber* such as **tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500**.

trans-unit.source: To get the port number, log in to the Azure Management Portal and find the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: To get the port number, log in to the Azure Management Portal and find the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: On the Dashboard, click **ENDPOINTS** and use the **PUBLIC PORT** assigned to **MSSQL**.
trans-unit.target: On the Dashboard, click **ENDPOINTS** and use the **PUBLIC PORT** assigned to **MSSQL**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Authentication** box, select **SQL Server Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Authentication** box, select **SQL Server Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Login** box, type the name of a login that you created in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: In the **Login** box, type the name of a login that you created in an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: In the **Password** box, type the password of the login that you create in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: In the **Password** box, type the password of the login that you create in an earlier task.
